signature.title: Signature
signature.description: Define how the JSON Web Token must be signed.

titleMap.HMAC_HS256: HS256 - HMAC with SHA-256, requires 256+ bit secret
titleMap.HMAC_HS384: HS384 - HMAC with SHA-384, requires 384+ bit secret
titleMap.HMAC_HS512: HS512 - HMAC with SHA-512, requires 512+ bit secret

keyResolver.title: Key resolver
keyResolver.description: Define how the private key / secret key must be resolved.

titleMap.INLINE: The content of the private key / secret key is provided inline
titleMap.PEM: The content of the private key is provided by reading a PEM file from filesystem (only for RS algorithms)
titleMap.JKS: The content of the private key is provided by reading a JKS file from filesystem (only for RS algorithms)
titleMap.PKCS12: The content of the private key is provided by reading a PKCS12 file from filesystem (only for RS algorithms)

alias.title: Key alias
alias.description: Alias used to access a keystore entry (only for JKS and PKCS#12)

storepass.title: Store password
storepass.description: Pass used to access the key store (only for JKS and PKCS#12)

keypass.title: Key password
keypass.description: Pass used to access the particular key pair's private key (only for JKS)

kid.title: Key ID
kid.description: Specifies the key ID (kid) to include in the JWT header

x5t.title: JWT x5t
x5t.description: Specifies the x5t header value, which need to be a Base64 URL encoding of the certificate SHA-1 fingerprint

x509CertificateChain.title: Certificate chain
x509CertificateChain.description: Whether a certificate chain should be added as an X5C attribute (only for RS256, JKS and PKCS#12)

titleMap.NONE: Do not add a certificate chain
titleMap.X5C: Add a certificate chain as an X5C attribute

id.title: JWT ID. Supports EL.
id.description: JWT ID (jti) claim is a unique identifier for the JWT. Defaults to UUID.

audiences.title: Audiences
audiences.description: Claim identifies the recipients that the JWT is intended for. Supports EL.

issuer.title: Issuer
issuer.description: Claim that identifies the issuer of the JWT. Supports EL.

expiresInUnit.title: Expires in unit
expiresInUnit.description: Lifespan of the JWT in seconds, minutes, hours, or days.

subject.title: Subject
subject.description: Claim identifies or makes a statement about the subject of the JWT. Supports EL.

content.title: Private key / Secret key / key store path
content.description: Specifies a PEM-encoded private key used to sign the JWT or the secret key used to sign tokens with an HMAC algorithm, or the path to your key store

codemirrorOptions.placeholder: Put PEM-encoded private key or the secret key or the path to your key store

customClaims.title: Custom claims
customClaims.description: Specify additional claim name/value pair(s) in the payload of the JWT

value.title: Value
value.description: Value of the claim. Supports EL.
